decks.notes: This Boros Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy and controlling the board through a combination of removal spells and enchantments. It also utilizes Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion to provide additional value and support for the deck's game plan. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and gaining incremental advantages over time, while using its mana base efficiently to cast its spells and maintain control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful instant and sorcery spells, using Jegantha as a companion. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and creature pump spells like Titan's Strength to deal quick and efficient damage. With a mix of versatile creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, along with strong support cards like Den of the Bugbear and Sulfurous Springs, the deck looks to maintain pressure and finish off the opponent quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures while generating a large amount of mana through devotion to green. By using cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Leyline of the Guildpact, the deck can quickly ramp up to powerful threats such as Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll. Additionally, cards like Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Storm the Festival provide card advantage and help maintain the deck's aggressive strategy. Overall, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and outpace the opponent in the early game.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful burn spells, focusing on dealing damage quickly and efficiently. The deck includes a companion card, Jegantha, the Wellspring, to provide additional value and flexibility. The combination of aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, along with burn spells like Titan's Strength and Ancestral Anger, allows for a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle. The deck also features cards like Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance and Den of the Bugbear to provide additional benefits and options during gameplay.

The focus of this deck is to utilize Transmogrify to cheat out powerful creatures like Reckoner Bankbuster and Valgavoth, Terror Eater. With disruption from cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the board while setting up its combo pieces. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of removal spells and utility lands to help maintain its game plan. Overall, the key strategy revolves around efficiently comboing off while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to consistently search for and play powerful creatures from the deck. The key strategy involves controlling the board with removal spells and enchantments like Chained to the Rocks and Leyline Binding while ramping up mana with cards like Up the Beanstalk. By using Yorion as a companion, the deck can maximize its potential with a larger starting hand size. The deck also includes a variety of powerful creatures with varying abilities to adapt to different situations and outvalue opponents.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push. Liliana of the Veil and Abhorrent Oculus provide additional control elements while Zoraline, Cosmos Caller and Skyclave Apparition offer versatile removal options. The deck also utilizes cards like Bitter Triumph and Tainted Indulgence to gain card advantage and generate value. The mana base is specifically tailored to support the Esper color combination, allowing for a variety of spells to be cast efficiently.
